title: Mum didn't have me vaccinated. As an adult, do I go against her decision?
text:
I thought about something the other day, something I have never properly wrestled with before.

I have not been vaccinated. I haven’t had the whooping cough vaccine, the MMR or the BCG. I actually remember not getting the BCG vividly. I was the only child in school who didn’t have it and was treated like some kind of irresponsible freak by the nurses. I was 13 years old.

Seventeen years later, and Matt Hancock has called for mandatory vaccinations because rates have fallen below the necessary levels. But this wasn’t what prompted me to think about my status as someone who hasn’t been vaccinated. That happened before at a midwife appointment which wasn’t even mine.

One of my dearest friends is...
